style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;shadow=0;sketch=0;shadowColor=#33FFFF;textShadow=1;fontColor=#FFFFFF;shadowOpacity=80;fontSize=17;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="32" y="85" width="110" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="YP2LvssRMxXgJCmg1-2v-44" value="<p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 12px;">Main purpose of the partitioner:</p><ul style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px;"><li><span style="background-color: initial;">Assess and estimate the workload to be executed by the step.</span></li><li><span style="background-color: initial;">Divide the workload into equal partitions.</span></li><li><span style="background-color: initial;">Create a Context</span><span style="background-color: initial;">&nbsp;for each partition.</span></li><li><span style="background-color: initial;">Assign Contexts with partitions to workers.</span></li></ul><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">Example:</p><ol style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px;"><li>Select IDs from <code>PAYMENTS</code> where status<code>&nbsp;= 'NEW'</code>.</li><li>Divide the result set of IDs into smaller partitions.</li><li>Create Context&nbsp;objects and pass the partitions into each contexts.</li></ol>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="12.5" y="128" width="239" height="262" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-5" value="PROCESSOR" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;shadow=0;sketch=0;shadowColor=#33FFFF;textShadow=1;fontColor=#FFFFFF;shadowOpacity=80;fontSize=17;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="1090.5" y="58" width="110" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-6" value="<p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">Processor is th<span style="background-color: initial;">e central point for implementing business logic and data transformation within the batch job.</span><br></p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><span style="background-color: initial;"><br></span></p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><span style="background-color: initial;">Example:</span></p><ol style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px;"><li><span style="background-color: initial;">The processor calculates the account settlement and updates the account's balance.</span></li><li>The processed objects are "wrapped" into an outputObject and passed to the writer.</li></ol>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="1068" y="104" width="234" height="177" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-8" value="WRITER" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;shadow=0;sketch=0;shadowColor=#33FFFF;textShadow=1;fontColor=#FFFFFF;shadowOpacity=80;fontSize=17;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="1577.5" y="60" width="110" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-9" value="<p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><span style="background-color: initial;">Writer persists the data and is responsible for committing the transaction. It also controls the number of items in a transaction via the </span><code style="background-color: initial;">chunkSize</code><span style="background-color: initial;"> parameter in the step configuration, reducing the I/O load on the database.</span><br></p><p style="margin-bottom: 0px;">Example:</p><ol style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><li>Sequentially receives chunks of data containing 2 items each.</li><li>Writes 2 new Settlement and updates 2 Account entries.</li><li>Commits the bulk transaction.</li></ol>" value="<p>Reader is responsible for supplying the processor with all necessary data. context, a list of IDs for a given partition.</li><li>Reads from the database all relevant information, such as the Payment entity itself, the associated User, and the User's account.&nbsp;</li><li>It li.span: Assess and estimate the workload to be executed by the step.
Divide the workload into equal partitions.
Assign Contexts with partitions to workers.

ol.li: Select IDs from PAYMENTS where status= 'NEW'.
Divide the result set of IDs into smaller partitions.
Create Contextobjects and pass the partitions into each contexts.

div.p: Reader is responsible for supplying the processor with all necessary data. It abstracts the details of data retrieval.

ol.li: The reader receives context, a list of IDs for a given partition.
Reads from the database all relevant information, such as the Payment entity itself, the associated User, and the User's account.
It builds an InputObjectthat holds these entities and passes it to the processor.
